Text: my drive is d/optiarc dvd rw ad 5240S is this conpatable ?

My drive is lite on dvdrw shw-16355

Am i good to go or no?

What part of the nfo that specifically says:

LiteOn iHas124-XX B
LiteOn iHas224-XX B
LiteOn iHas324-XX B
LiteOn iHas424-XX B
LiteOn iHas524-XX B
LiteOn iHas624-XX B

Can you not understand. You MUST have the ABOVE drives.

It's only these 6 drive models and nothing else, and even with those you have to be careful to use the right firmware file, e.g. you cannot swap 324  624. If you're not sure, let someone do it for you who has flashed before and understands this tutorial.

quote name='Exobex' date='Oct 19 2011, 12:32 AM' post='4833697']

Here are some other drives which should be compatible. Click them to find the page I got the info from and judge for yourselves. Many of these drives have LabelFlash/LightScribe technology so can be crossflashed all the way up to IHAS624. Those without can be crossflashed all the way up to IHAS524 (you can probably use IHAS624 but they still won't have LabelFlash/LightScribe as the hardware's missing).

ASUS
DRW-24B3LT
DRW-24B3ST

HEWLETT PACKARD (HP)
DVD 1270i B

PIONEER(a BK suffix I think indicates that it has a black bezel, so variations of these probably all work)
DVR-219CHV
DVR-219LBK
DVR-219VXL
DVR-S19FX
DVR-S19L

PLEXTOR
PL-L890SA

QSI
DDW-242S

See here for the crossflash software links. I did read on one of the links that your SATA controller needs to be in IDE mode to perform the flash, not AHCI, just to let you know!

@uggenabben

The developer will only provide firmwares for LiteOns (cf. http://c4evaspeaks.com/). If you think you can crossflash various makes and models, just because they share black bezels, go ahead and brick them.
